channel.title: Hazards to education
channel.description:
Walgreen Lecture series on the present hazards to American education as seen and presented by Robert M. Hutchins. Each lecture discusses one particular problem.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Social and political conformity, part two
item.description: This program, the second of two parts, presents a lecture on the hazards that social and political conformity present to education.
item.dc:creator: University of Chicago
item.dc:subject: United States--Politics and government

item.title: Industrialization, part one
item.description: This program, the first of two parts, focuses on the hazards that industrialization poses to education.
item.dc:creator: University of Chicago
item.dc:subject: United States

item.title: Philosophical diversity, part one
item.description: This program, the first of two parts, focuses on the hazards that philosophical diversity poses to education.
item.dc:creator: University of Chicago
item.dc:subject: United States

item.title: Specialization, part one
item.description: This program, the first of two parts, focuses on the hazards that specialization, or the lack of a broader education, poses to education.
item.dc:creator: University of Chicago
item.dc:subject: United States
